topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c5f42763687239bc550100#post_53c5f42763687239bc550100
New media sites will simply take their places. God knows what other sites SJWs may infect and repeat everything again. Perhaps we should warn future generations of website hosts about them, and teach them how to repel such people from their website. The key is to not let SJWs feel anywhere at home. Let them wander in the deep vacuums of the internet for eternity.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c5f4a06368723b785f0100#post_53c5f4a06368723b785f0100
[bq="twistedmetalero"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c5f42763687239bc550100#post_53c5f42763687239bc550100

except derpibooru right?

LONG LIVE DERPIBOORU.

but really i would love to see the day youtube stops existing so we can change to a better service.[/bq]
Don't know.  At the rate we're going in say fifty years a cellphone will be more powerful than the total mental computational ability of the entire human race.  Chances are society, the internet, the world, governments and so forth will forever be changed in ways we can't even begin to imagine yet.

What I mean by this in say two decades even a small company will be able to have their own cheap versions of youtube so not only will sites like youtube cease to exist but a lot of things we view as absolute may cease to exist as well due to technological changes making massive cultural changes.  For all we know "society" in the traditional sense may cease to exist

!http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/8/8c/Dryptosaurus_SIZE.png!
Basically the love child of a _Tyrannosaurus rex_ and a raptor.

topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c5f56b63687239e8c10100#post_53c5f56b63687239e8c10100
[bq="Gizoid101"]"@CogWeaver":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c5f3766368723901c90000#post_53c5f3766368723901c90000

What's the difference between using Tablet and using the PC's mouse?
[/bq]
Using the mouse is usually only comfortable for drawing if you're using the Pen Tool in programs such as Illustrator, and that's really only good if you want to make vectors.  Using a tablet allows you to draw right onto the computer without hours of mindless clicking with the Pen Tool, jagged brush "strokes" with a mouse, and without the grittiness that you get from scanning in a pencil/pen and paper drawing.
Or really, I guess the biggest difference is if you're using a mouse use programs like Illustrator, and if you're using a tablet use programs like Photoshop.
topics.author: 4fde0c7e945b706cc30003eb
